text: Psalm 81
An Appeal from God to Israel

For the \add music\add* director; on the Gittith. Of Asaph.\f + \fr Ps 81 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one \f*
Shout out to God our strength;
shout joyfully to the God of Jacob.
Lift up a song and strike\f + \fr 81:2 \ft Hebrew “give” \f* \add the\add* tambourine,
\add the\add* pleasant lyre, together with \add the\add* harp.
Blow \add the\add* horn at new moon,
at full moon, for our feast day,
because it \add is\add* a statute for Israel,
an ordinance of the God of Jacob.
He made it a statute\f + \fr 81:5 \ft Hebrew “testimony” or “witness” \f* in Joseph
when he went out against the land of Egypt,
\add where\add* I heard a language I did not know.\f + \fr 81:5 \ft The meaning of this line is uncertain. The above is based on perhaps a similar thought in \xt Psa 114:1 \ft \f*
“I removed his shoulder from a burden.
His hands were freed from \add the\add* basket.
In this\f + \fr 81:7 \ft Hebrew “the” \f* trouble you called, and I rescued you.
Within \add the\add* secret place of thunder I answered you;
I tested you at the waters of Meribah. \qs Selah\qs*
Hear, O my people, and I will admonish you;
O Israel, if you would \add but\add* listen to me.
There shall be no strange god among you,
and you shall not bow down to a foreign god.
I \add am\add* Yahweh your God,
who brought you up from the land of Egypt.
Open wide your mouth and I will fill it.
But my people did not listen to my voice,
and Israel did not yield to me.
So I let them\f + \fr 81:12 \ft Hebrew “him” \f* go in the stubbornness of their heart;
they walked in their counsels.
Oh that my people would listen to me;
\add that\add* Israel would walk in my ways.
I would subdue their enemies quickly,
and turn my hand against their adversaries.
Those who hate Yahweh would cringe before him,
and their fate\f + \fr 81:15 \ft Hebrew “time” \f* would be forever.
But he would feed him\f + \fr 81:16 \ft That is, Israel \f* from \add the\add* choicest wheat,\f + \fr 81:16 \ft Hebrew “\fq the \ft fat of wheat” \f*
and I would satisfy you with honey from a rock.”
